1.verse: A New Creation -In the Beginning Was the Word -Chapter 1 -The Word of God, Source of Life -In the beginning was the Word,and the Word was with God,and the Word was God.

2.verse: He was with God in the very beginning.

3.verse: Through him all things came into existence,and without him there was nothing.That which came to be

4.verse: found life in him,and the life was the light of the human race.

5.verse: The light shines in the darkness,and the darkness has been unable to overcome it.

6.verse: Faith Means Welcoming the Word of God Made Man. -A man appeared, sent by God, whose name was John.

7.verse: He came as a witness to give testimony to the light, so that through him all might come to believe.

8.verse: He himself was not the light; his role was to bear witness to the light.

9.verse: The true light that enlightens everyonewas coming into the world.

10.verse: He was in the world,the world had come into existence through him,yet the world did not recognize him.

11.verse: He came to his own,but his own did not accept him.

12.verse: However, to those who did accept himand who believed in his namehe granted the power to become children of God,

13.verse: who were born not from bloodor human desire or human will,but from God.

14.verse: And the Word became fleshand dwelt among us.And we saw his glory,the glory as of the Father’s only Son,full of grace and truth.

15.verse: Jesus Christ, Fullness of Truth. -John testified to him, proclaiming, “This is the one of whom I said, ‘The one who comes after me ranks ahead of me because he existed before me.’ ”

16.verse: From his fullness we have all received,grace upon grace.

17.verse: For the Law was given through Moses,but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

18.verse: No one has ever seen God.It is the only Son, God,who is at the Father’s side,who has made him known.

19.verse: Jesus Is the Expected Messiah -John the Baptist Is Not the Messiah. -This is the testimony offered by John when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”

20.verse: He confessed, he did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”

21.verse: Then they asked him, “Who then are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” He answered, “No.”

22.verse: Therefore, they said to him, “Who are you, so we may have an answer to give to those who sent us? What do you have to say about yourself?”

23.verse: He replied, in the words of the prophet Isaiah,“I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness,‘Make straight the way of the Lord.’ ”

24.verse: Some Pharisees were present in this group,

25.verse: and they asked him, “Why then are you baptizing if you are neither the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”

26.verse: John answered them, “I baptize with water; but among you there is one whom you do not know,

27.verse: the one who is coming after me. I am not worthy to loosen the strap of his sandal.”

28.verse: This took place in Bethany, beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

29.verse: Behold, the Lamb of God, Who Takes Away the Sin of the World. -The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him, and he said,“Behold, the Lamb of God,who takes away the sin of the world.

30.verse: This is the one of whom I said,‘After me is coming onewho ranks ahead of mebecause he existed before me.’

31.verse: I myself did not know him,but the reason I came to baptize with waterwas so that he might be revealed to Israel.”

32.verse: John also gave this testimony, saying,“I saw the Spiritdescending from heaven like a dove,and it came to rest on him.

33.verse: I myself did not know him,but the one who sent me to baptize with water told me,‘The one on whom you see the Spirit descend and restis the one who is to baptize with the Holy Spirit.’

34.verse: And I myself have seen and have testifiedthat this is the Son of God.”

35.verse: We Have Found the Messiah. -The next day John was standing there with two of his disciples,

36.verse: and as he watched Jesus pass by, he said, “Behold, the Lamb of God.”

37.verse: On hearing him say this, the two disciples began to follow Jesus.

38.verse: When Jesus turned and saw them following him, he asked them, “What are you looking for?” They said to him, “Rabbi” (which, translated, is “Teacher”), “where are you staying?”

39.verse: He answered them, “Come and see.” So they went and saw where he was staying, and they remained with him for the rest of that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.

40.verse: One of the two who had heard John speak and had followed Jesus was Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter.

41.verse: The first thing Andrew did was to seek out his brother Simon and say to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which, translated, is “Christ”),

42.verse: and he took him to Jesus. Jesus gazed at him and said, “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which, translated, is “Peter”).

43.verse: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. Encountering Philip, he said to him, “Follow me.”

44.verse: Philip came from the same town, Bethsaida, as Andrew and Peter.

45.verse: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found the one about whom Moses in the Law and also the Prophets wrote—Jesus the son of Joseph, from Nazareth.”

46.verse: Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come from Nazareth?” Philip replied, “Come and see.”

47.verse: When Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him, he said of him, “Behold, a true Israelite, in whom there is no deception.”

48.verse: Nathanael asked him, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip summoned you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

49.verse: Nathanael said to him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God. You are the King of Israel.”

50.verse: Jesus responded, “Do you believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than that.”

51.verse: Then he added, “Amen, amen, I say to you, you will see the heavens opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”

1.verse: The First Sign Worked by Jesus -Chapter 2 -The Wedding Feast at Cana. -On the third day, there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee. The mother of Jesus was there,

2.verse: and Jesus and his disciples had also been invited.

3.verse: When the wine was exhausted, the mother of Jesus said to him, “They have no wine.”

4.verse: Jesus responded, “Woman, what concern is this to us? My hour has not yet come.”

5.verse: His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”

6.verse: Now standing nearby there were six stone water jars, of the type used for Jewish rites of purification, each holding twenty to thirty gallons.

7.verse: Jesus instructed the servants, “Fill the jars with water.” When they had filled them to the brim,

8.verse: he ordered them, “Now draw some out and take it to the chief steward,” and they did so.

9.verse: When the chief steward tasted the water that had become wine, he did not know where it came from, although the servants who had drawn the water knew. The chief steward called over the bridegroom

10.verse: and said, “Everyone serves the choice wine first, and then an inferior vintage when the guests have been drinking for a while. However, you have saved the best wine until now.”

11.verse: Jesus performed this, the first of his signs, at Cana in Galilee, thereby revealing his glory, and his disciples believed in him.

12.verse: After this, he went down to Capernaum with his mother, his brethren, and his disciples, and they remained there for a few days.

13.verse: Worship of the Father in Spirit and Truth -The Mystery of the New Temple -Jesus Casts the Merchants Out of the Temple. -When the time of the Passover of the Jews was near, Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

14.verse: In the temple he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves, as well as money changers seated at their tables.

15.verse: Making a whip of cords, he drove them all out of the temple, including the sheep and the cattle. He also overturned the tables of the money changers, scattering their coins,

16.verse: and to those who were selling the doves he ordered, “Take them out of here! Stop turning my Father’s house into a marketplace!”

17.verse: His disciples recalled the words of Scripture, “Zeal for your house will consume me.”

18.verse: The Jews then challenged him, “What sign can you show us to justify your doing this?”

19.verse: Jesus answered, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”

20.verse: The Jews responded, “This temple has taken forty-six years to build, and you are going to raise it up in three days!”

21.verse: But the temple he was talking about was the temple of his body.

22.verse: After he had risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the Scripture and the words that Jesus had spoken.

23.verse: The Mystery of the New Covenant -Jesus in Jerusalem. -While Jesus was in Jerusalem for the feast of Passover, many people saw the signs he was performing and came to believe in his name.

24.verse: However, Jesus would not entrust himself to them because he fully understood them all.

25.verse: He did not need evidence from others about man, for he clearly understood men.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Nicodemus Goes To Visit Jesus. -There was a man from the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a member of the Jewish ruling council,

2.verse: who came to Jesus at night. “Rabbi,” he said, “we know that you are a teacher who has come from God, for no one would be able to perform the signs that you do unless God were with him.”

3.verse: Jesus replied,“Amen, amen, I say to you,no one can see the kingdom of Godwithout being born from above.”

4.verse: Nicodemus asked, “How can a man be born again once he is old? Is it possible for him to enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”

5.verse: Jesus said,“Amen, amen, I say to you,no one can enter the kingdom of Godunless he is born of water and the Spirit.

6.verse: What is born of the flesh is flesh,and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.

7.verse: “You should not be astonished when I say,‘You must be born from above.’

8.verse: The wind blows where it chooses,and you hear the sound of it,but you do not know where it comes fromor where it goes.So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”

9.verse: “How is this possible?” asked Nicodemus.

10.verse: Jesus responded, “You are a teacher of Israel and you do not know these things?

11.verse: “Amen, amen, I say to you,we speak of what we knowand we testify to what we have seen,and yet you do not accept our testimony.

12.verse: If I tell you about earthly thingsand you do not believe,how will you believewhen I speak to you about heavenly things?

13.verse: Jesus Christ, Savior and Judge -“No one has gone up to heavenexcept the one who descended from heaven,the Son of Man.

14.verse: And just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the desert,so must the Son of Man be lifted up,

15.verse: in order that everyone who believes in himmay have eternal life.

16.verse: “For God so loved the worldthat he gave his only Son,so that everyone who believes in himmay not perishbut may attain eternal life.

17.verse: “For God did not send his Son into the worldto condemn the worldbut in order that the world might be saved through him.

18.verse: Whoever believes in him is not condemned,but whoever does not believe in himalready stands condemned,because he has not believed in the nameof the only-begotten Son of God.

19.verse: “And the judgment is this:the light has come into the world,but people preferred darkness to lightbecause their deeds were evil.

20.verse: Everyone who does evil hates the lightand avoids coming near the lightso that his misdeeds may not be exposed.

21.verse: However, whoever lives by the truthcomes to the lightso that it may be clearly seenthat his deeds have been donein God.”

22.verse: Final Witness of John the Baptist. -After this, Jesus went with his disciples into the Judean countryside, where he spent some time with them and baptized.

23.verse: John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salem, because there was an abundance of water there, and people were coming to be baptized.

24.verse: At that time, John had not yet been imprisoned.

25.verse: Now a dispute about ceremonial washings arose between a certain Jew and the disciples of John.

26.verse: Therefore, they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, the one who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you bore witness, is baptizing, and everyone is flocking to him.”

27.verse: John replied,“No one can receive anythingexcept what has been given to him from heaven.

28.verse: You yourselves can testify that I said,‘I am not the Christ.I have been sent before him.’

29.verse: “It is the bridegroom who has the bride,but the friend of the bridegroomwho stands by and listens for himrejoices greatly when he hears the bridegroom’s voice.This joy of mineis complete.

31.verse: He Who Comes from Above -“The one who comes from above is above all.The one who is of the earth is earthlyand speaks of earthly things.The one who comes from heaven is above all.

32.verse: He bears witness to the things he has seen and heard,yet no one accepts his testimony.

33.verse: “Whoever accepts his testimonyattests that God speaks the truth.

34.verse: For the one whom God has sentspeaks the words of God,for God gives him the Spirit without measure.

35.verse: The Father loves the Son,and he has entrusted everything into his hand.

36.verse: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life;whoever does not believe in the Son will not see life,but the wrath of God rests upon him.”

1.verse: The Savior of the World and the New Worship -Chapter 4 -Journeying to Galilee through Samaria. -Now when the Lord learned that the Pharisees had been informed that he had more disciples and was baptizing more people than John

2.verse: (although actually it was not Jesus himself but his disciples who were baptizing),

3.verse: he left Judea and set forth for Galilee.

4.verse: Jesus and the Samaritan Woman. -He had to pass through Samaria.

5.verse: So he came to a Samaritan town called Sychar, near the plot of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.

6.verse: Jacob’s well was there, and Jesus, tired from his journey, sat down at the well. It was about noon.

7.verse: When a Samaritan woman came to draw water, Jesus said to her, “Give me some water to drink.”

8.verse: His disciples had gone into the town to purchase food.

9.verse: The Samaritan woman said to him, “You are a Jew. How can you ask me, a Samaritan woman, for some water to drink?” (Jews do not share anything in common with Samaritans.)

10.verse: Jesus replied,“If you recognized the gift of Godand who it is that is asking you for something to drink,you would have asked himand he would have given you living water.”

11.verse: “Sir,” the woman said, “you do not have a bucket, and the well is deep. Where can you get this living water?

12.verse: Are you greater than our ancestor Jacob who gave us this well and drank from it himself along with his sons and his cattle?”

13.verse: Jesus said to her,“Everyone who drinks this waterwill be thirsty again.

14.verse: But whoever drinks the water that I will give himwill never be thirsty.The water that I will give himwill become a spring of water within himwelling up to eternal life.”

15.verse: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water so that I may not be thirsty and have to come here to draw water.”

16.verse: Jesus told her, “Go, call your husband and come back here.”

17.verse: The woman answered him, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You are right in saying, ‘I have no husband’;

18.verse: for you have had five husbands, and the man you have now is not your husband. What you have said is true.”

19.verse: The woman said to him, “Sir, I can see that you are a prophet.

20.verse: Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain, but you say that the place where people must worship is in Jerusalem.”

21.verse: Jesus told her,“Believe me, woman,the hour is comingwhen you will worship the Fatherneither on this mountainnor in Jerusalem.

22.verse: You worship what you do not know;we worship what we do know,for salvation is from the Jews.

23.verse: “But the hour is coming,indeed it is already here,when the true worshiperswill worship the Fatherin Spirit and truth.Indeed it is worshipers like thesethat the Father seeks.

24.verse: God is Spirit,and those who worship himmust worship in Spirit and truth.”

25.verse: The woman said to him, “I know that the Messiah is coming, the one who is called Christ. When he comes, he will reveal everything to us.”

26.verse: Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one who is speaking to you.”

27.verse: At this point, his disciples returned, and they were astonished to find him speaking with a woman, but no one asked, “What do you want from her?” or “Why are you conversing with her?”

28.verse: The woman left behind her water jar and went off to the town, where she said to the people,

29.verse: “Come and see a man who told me everything I have ever done. Could this be the Christ?”

30.verse: And so they departed from the town and made their way to see him.

31.verse: The Time of the Harvest. -Meanwhile, the disciples urged him, “Rabbi, eat something.”

32.verse: But he told them,“I have food to eatabout which you do not know.”

33.verse: Then his disciples said to one another, “Could someone have brought him something to eat?”

34.verse: Jesus said to them,“My food is to do the willof the one who sent me,and to accomplish his work.

35.verse: Do you not have a saying,‘Four months more,and then comes the harvest’?“I tell you,open your eyes and look at the fields;already they are white for the harvest.

36.verse: The reaper is even now receiving his pay;already he is gathering the crops for eternal lifeso that the sower and the reaper can rejoice together.

37.verse: “Thus, the saying holds true,‘One sows and another reaps.’

38.verse: I sent you to reapwhat you had not worked for.Others have performed the work,and you have reaped the benefits of their labor.”

39.verse: Jesus Is Truly the Savior of the World. -Many Samaritans from that town came to believe in him because of the woman’s testimony, “He told me everything I have ever done.”

40.verse: So when the Samaritans came to him, they pleaded with him to stay with them, and he remained there for two days.

41.verse: And many more began to believe in him because of the words he spoke to them.

42.verse: They said to the woman, “We no longer believe simply because of what you said, for we have heard him for ourselves, and we are convinced that this man is truly the Savior of the world.”

43.verse: Return to Galilee. -When the two days were over, Jesus departed for Galilee.

44.verse: He himself had declared that a prophet is not treated with honor in his own hometown.

45.verse: When he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, since they had seen all he had done in Jerusalem during the feast, having been at the feast themselves.

46.verse: Jesus Heals the Official’s Son. -He went again to Cana in Galilee where he had changed the water into wine. At Capernaum, there was a royal official whose son was ill.

47.verse: When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and pleaded that he come and heal his son who was near death.

48.verse: Jesus said to him, “Unless you witness signs and wonders, you will not believe.”

49.verse: The royal official said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

50.verse: Jesus replied, “Return home. Your son will live.”The man believed what Jesus said to him, and he departed.

51.verse: While he was still on his way, his servants met him saying that his child was going to live.

52.verse: He asked them at what time the boy had begun to recover, and they told him, “The fever left him yesterday at one o’clock in the afternoon.”

53.verse: Then the father realized that was the exact hour at which Jesus had assured him, “Your son will live,” and he and his entire household came to believe.

54.verse: This was the second sign that Jesus performed after returning from Judea into Galilee.

1.verse: Jesus Restores the Work of God -Chapter 5 -The Sign Given on a Sabbath. -Some time later, Jesus went up to Jerusalem for one of the Jewish feasts.

2.verse: Now in Jerusalem, by the Sheep Gate, there is a pool that in Hebrew is called Bethesda. It has five porticos,

3.verse: and in these a large number of invalids used to lie, people who were blind, lame, and paralyzed, waiting for the movement of the water. [

4.verse: For occasionally an angel of the Lord would come down into the pool and stir up the water. The first one into the pool after each such disturbance would be cured of whatever disease he had.]

5.verse: A man who was there had been an invalid for thirty-eight years.

6.verse: When Jesus saw him lying there and was aware that he had been ill for a long time, he said to him, “Do you want to get well?”

7.verse: The invalid answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up. While I am still on my way, someone else steps into the pool ahead of me.”

8.verse: Jesus said to him, “Rise! Take up your mat and walk!”

9.verse: Immediately, the man was cured, and he took up his mat and began to walk.Now that day was a Sabbath.

10.verse: Therefore, the Jews said to the man who had been cured, “Today is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry your mat.”

11.verse: He replied, “The man who cured me said to me, ‘Take up your mat and walk!’ ”

12.verse: They asked him, “Who is the man who told you to take it up and walk?”

13.verse: But the man who had been cured did not know who it was, for Jesus had disappeared into the crowd that was there.

14.verse: Later, Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “See, you have been made well. Do not sin anymore, so that nothing worse happens to you.”

15.verse: The man went away and told the Jews that Jesus was the man who had made him well.

16.verse: Therefore, the Jews began to harass Jesus because he was doing such things on the Sabbath.

17.verse: However, Jesus responded to them, saying,“My Father is still working,and I am at work as well.”

18.verse: For this reason, the Jews became even more determined to kill him, because he was not only breaking the Sabbath but also calling God his own Father, making himself equal to God.

19.verse: The Work of the Son. -Jesus replied to them, saying,“Amen, amen, I say to you,the Son can do nothing by himself;he can do only what he sees the Father doing.For whatever the Father does,the Son also does.

20.verse: For the Father loves the Sonand shows him everythingthat he himself is doing.And he will show himeven greater works than these,so that you might be astonished.

21.verse: “Indeed, just as the Father raises the deadand gives them life,so does the Son give lifeto anyone he chooses.

22.verse: The Father judges no one,for he has entrusted all judgment to the Son,

23.verse: so that all may honor the Sonas they honor the Father.Anyone who does not honor the Sondoes not honor the Father who sent him.

24.verse: “Amen, amen, I say to you,whoever hears my wordsand believes in the one who sent mepossesses eternal life.He will not come to judgmentbut has passed from death to life.

25.verse: “Amen, amen, I say to you,the hour is coming,indeed it is already here,when the dead will hearthe voice of the Son of God,and all those who hear it will live.

26.verse: For just as the Father has life in himself,so also he has granted the Son to have life in himself.

27.verse: And he has also granted himthe power to pass judgment,because he is the Son of Man.

28.verse: “Do not be astonished at this,for the hour is comingwhen all those who are in their graveswill hear his voice

29.verse: and will come forth from their graves.Those who have done good deedswill rise to life,while those who have done evilwill rise to judgment.

30.verse: “I can do nothing on my own.As I hear, I judge,and my judgment is just,because I seek to donot my own willbut the will of him who sent me.

31.verse: A Witness to Jesus -“If I were to testify about myself,my testimony would not be true.

32.verse: However, there is another who testifies about me,and I know that his testimony is true,the testimony he bore concerning me.

33.verse: You sent messengers to John,and he has testified to the truth.

34.verse: Not that I accept such human testimony,but I say these thingsso that you may be saved.

35.verse: “John was a burning and shining lamp,and for a time you were willingto exult in his light.

36.verse: But I have testimony that is greater than John’s.The works that my Fatherhas given me to accomplish,the very works that I am doing,testify about me,that the Father has sent me.

37.verse: “And the Father who sent mehas himself testified about me.You have not heard his voiceor seen his form,

38.verse: and you do not have his wordabiding in you,because you do not believehim whom he has sent.

39.verse: “Search the Scriptures carefullybecause you believe that through themyou will gain eternal life.Even they testify on my behalf.

40.verse: Yet you refuse to come to meto receive that life.

41.verse: Unbelief of Jesus’ Hearers -“I do not accept the praise of men.

42.verse: Moreover, I know that you do not havethe love of God in your hearts.

43.verse: I have come in the name of my Father,yet you do not accept me.But if another should come in his own name,you will accept him.

44.verse: How can you believewhen you accept praise from one another,yet you do not seekthe praise that comes fromthe only God?

45.verse: “Do not think that I will accuse youbefore the Father.You have placed your hope in Moses,and he is the one who will accuse you.

46.verse: If you truly believed Moses,you would have believed in me,for it is about me that he wrote.

47.verse: But since you do not believe what he wrote,how will you believe what I say?”

1.verse: The Bread of Life -Chapter 6 -Signs of Salvation -Jesus Feeds the Crowds. -After this, Jesus crossed the Sea of Galilee, also called the Sea of Tiberias,

2.verse: and a large crowd of people followed him because they saw the signs he performed on the sick.

3.verse: Jesus went up on a mountainside and sat down there with his disciples.

4.verse: The Jewish feast of Passover was approaching.

5.verse: When Jesus looked up and saw a large crowd coming toward him, he said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread for them to eat?”

6.verse: He said this to test him, because Jesus himself knew what he was going to do.

7.verse: Philip answered him, “Two hundred days’ wages would not buy enough bread for each of them to have a small piece.”

8.verse: One of his disciples, Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, said to him,

9.verse: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish. But what help will they be among so many?”

10.verse: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” Now there was plenty of grass in that place, so the men sat down, about five thousand of them.

11.verse: Then Jesus took the loaves, and when he had given thanks, he distributed them to the people who were sitting there. He did the same with the fish, as much as they wanted.

12.verse: When they all had eaten enough, he said to the disciples, “Gather up the fragments that are left over, so that nothing will be wasted.”

13.verse: So they gathered them up and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves left by those who had eaten.

14.verse: When the people saw the sign he had performed, they began to say, “This is indeed the Prophet who is to come into the world.”

15.verse: Then Jesus realized that they were going to come and carry him off to make him king, so he again withdrew to the mountain by himself.

16.verse: Jesus Walks on the Water. -When evening came, the disciples went down to the sea,

17.verse: got into a boat, and set out across the sea to Capernaum. It was already dark, and Jesus had not yet joined them.

18.verse: The sea then became rough because a strong wind had started to blow.

19.verse: When they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and approaching the boat, and they were terrified.

20.verse: But he said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid!”

21.verse: They were ready to take him into the boat, but the boat immediately reached the shore toward which they were heading.

22.verse: Jesus, the Bread of Life for Believers -Earthly Food and Heavenly Bread. -The next day, the crowd that had stayed on the other side of the sea realized that there had only been one boat there, and that Jesus had not gone along with his disciples; rather, the disciples had left by themselves.

23.verse: Then some boats from Tiberias came near the place where the people had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

24.verse: When the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they themselves got into the boats and came to Capernaum looking for Jesus.

25.verse: When the people found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him, “Rabbi, when did you come here?”

26.verse: Jesus answered them,“Amen, amen, I say to you,you came looking for menot because you have seen signsbut because you ate the loavesand your hunger was satisfied.

27.verse: Do not work for food that perishesbut for the food that endures for eternal life,which the Son of Man will give you.For it is on himthat God the Father has set his seal.”

28.verse: Then they asked him, “What must we do if we are to carry out the works of God?”

29.verse: Jesus replied,“This is the work of God:to believe in the one whom he has sent.”

30.verse: They asked him further, “What sign can you give us that we can see and come to believe in you? What work will you do?

31.verse: Our ancestors ate manna in the desert. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ”

32.verse: Jesus replied,“Amen, amen, I say to you,it was not Moseswho gave you the bread from heaven.It is my Fatherwho gives you the true bread from heaven.

33.verse: For the bread of God ishe who comes down from heavenand gives life to the world.”

34.verse: The Bread of Life. -“Sir,” they begged him, “give us this bread always.”

35.verse: Jesus answered them,“I am the bread of life.Whoever comes to me will never be hungry,and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.

36.verse: But I said to you that you have seen meand yet you do not believe.

37.verse: All that the Father gives mewill come to me,and anyone who comes to meI will never turn away.

38.verse: For I have come down from heavennot to do my own willbut the will of him who sent me.

39.verse: “And this is the will of him who sent me:that I should lose nothingof all that he has given me,but that I should raise it upon the last day.

40.verse: This indeed is the will of my Father:that all who see the Sonand believe in himmay have eternal life,and I shall raise them upon the last day.”

41.verse: Faith, a Gift of God. -Then the Jews murmured about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”

42.verse: They said, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph? We know his father and mother. How can he say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”

44.verse: “No one can come to meunless he is drawn by the Father who sent me,and I will raise up that person on the last day.

45.verse: It is written in the Prophets,‘They will all be taught by God.’Everyone who has listened to my Fatherand learned from him comes to me.

46.verse: Not that anyone has seen the Fatherexcept the one who is from God;he has seen the Father.

47.verse: “Amen, amen, I say to you,whoever believes has eternal life.

48.verse: My Flesh for the Life of the World -“I am the bread of life.

49.verse: Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness,and yet they died.

50.verse: This is the bread that comes down from heaven,so that one may eat it and not die.

51.verse: I am the living bread that came down from heaven.Whoever eats this bread will live forever;and the bread that I will giveis my flesh, for the life of the world.”

52.verse: Then the Jews started to argue among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

53.verse: Jesus said to them,“Amen, amen, I say to you,unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Manand drink his blood,you do not have life within you.

54.verse: Whoever feeds upon my fleshand drinks my bloodhas eternal life,and I will raise him up on the last day.

55.verse: For my flesh is real food,and my blood is real drink.

56.verse: “Whoever feeds upon my flesh and drinks my blooddwells in me and I dwell in him.

57.verse: Just as the living Father sent meand I have life because of the Father,so whoever feeds upon me will live because of me.

58.verse: This is the bread that came down from heaven.Unlike your ancestors who ateand nevertheless died,the one who feeds upon this breadwill live forever.”

59.verse: The Holy One of God. -Jesus said these things while he was teaching in the synagogue at Capernaum.

60.verse: After hearing his words, many of his disciples said, “This is a hard saying. Who can accept it?”

61.verse: Aware of the complaints of his disciples, Jesus said to them,“Does this shock you?

62.verse: What then if you were to behold the Son of Manascend to where he was before?

63.verse: It is the spirit that gives life;the flesh can achieve nothing.The words that I have spoken to youare spirit and life.

64.verse: But there are some among youwho do not believe.”For from the very beginning Jesus knew who did not believe, and who would betray him.

65.verse: He said,“This is why I told youthat no one can come to meunless it is granted to him by my Father.”

66.verse: After this, many of his disciples turned away and no longer remained with him.

67.verse: Then Jesus said to the Twelve, “Do you also wish to leave?”

68.verse: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.

69.verse: We have come to believe and know that you are the Holy One of God.”

70.verse: Jesus replied, “Did I not choose you twelve? Yet one of you is a devil.”

71.verse: He was speaking of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. Although he was one of the Twelve, he would be the one who would betray him.

1.verse: The Light of the World -Jesus, Sign of Contradiction -Chapter 7 -Jesus’ Time Has Not Yet Been Fulfilled. -After this, Jesus resumed his travels throughout Galilee. He did not want to go about in Judea because the Jews were seeking to kill him.

2.verse: However, when the Jewish feast of Tabernacles was drawing near,

3.verse: his brethren said to him, “Depart from here and go into Judea so that your disciples can perceive the works you are doing.

4.verse: No one who wishes to be publicly known acts in secret. Since you are doing these things, reveal yourself to the world.”

5.verse: For not even his brethren believed in him.

6.verse: Jesus answered them,“My time has not yet come,but your time is always right.

7.verse: The world cannot hate you,but it does hate mebecause I testify against itthat its works are evil.

8.verse: Go up to the feast yourselves.I am not going to this feast,because my time has not yet fully come.”

9.verse: After he had said this, he stayed behind in Galilee.

10.verse: Later, however, after his brethren had gone up to the feast, he himself also went, not publicly, but in secret.

11.verse: During the feast the Jews were looking for him and asking, “Where is he?”

12.verse: There was widespread murmuring about him among the crowds. Some maintained, “He is a good man,” but others insisted, “No, for he is leading the people astray.”

13.verse: However, no one spoke openly about him for fear of the Jews.

14.verse: Do Not Judge by Appearances. -When the feast was half over, Jesus went up into the temple and began to teach.

15.verse: The Jews were astonished, and they wondered, “How has this man acquired such knowledge when he has never studied?”

16.verse: Jesus answered them,“My teaching is not my own;rather, it comes from him who sent me.

17.verse: Anyone who resolves to do his willwill know whether my teaching comes from Godor whether I am speaking on my own authority.

18.verse: Whoever speaks on his own authorityis simply seeking his own glory,but whoever seeks the gloryof the one who sent himis a truthful person,and there is no dishonesty in him.

19.verse: “Did not Moses give you the Law?And not one of you keeps the Law.Why are you trying to kill me?”

20.verse: The crowd shouted, “You are possessed! Who is trying to kill you?”

21.verse: Jesus replied,“I performed a single work,and all of you are astonished.

22.verse: Moses gave you circumcision—although it did not originate with Mosesbut with the patriarchs—and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.

23.verse: Now if a man can be circumcised on the Sabbathso that the Law of Moses may not be broken,why are you angry with mefor making a man’s entire bodycompletely healthy on the Sabbath?

24.verse: Do not base your judgment on appearances;judge according to what is right.”

25.verse: Where Is Jesus from and Where Is He Going? -Then some of the inhabitants of Jerusalem said, “Is this not the man they are trying to kill?

26.verse: And yet he is speaking publicly, and they say nothing to him! Can it be that the authorities realize that he is the Christ?

27.verse: And yet we know where this man is from. But when the Christ appears, no one will know where he is from.”

28.verse: Then Jesus cried out as he was teaching in the temple,“You know me,and you also know where I am from.Yet I have not come of my own accord,but he who sent me is true.You do not know him,

29.verse: but I know himbecause I am from himand it was he who sent me.”

30.verse: So they tried to arrest him, but no one laid a hand on him because his hour had not yet come.

31.verse: Yet many in the crowd believed in him, and they said, “When the Christ comes, will he perform more signs than this man has accomplished?”

32.verse: When the Pharisees overheard the crowd murmuring about him, the chief priests and the Pharisees sent temple guards to arrest him.

33.verse: Jesus then said,“I will remain with youonly for a short time longer,and then I shall returnto him who sent me.

34.verse: You will search for me,but you will not find me,for where I am you cannot come.”

35.verse: The Jews said to one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we will not be able to find him? Will he go abroad to the people who are dispersed among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?

36.verse: What does he mean when he says, ‘You will search for me, but you will be unable to find me,’ and ‘Where I am you cannot come’?”

37.verse: Streams of Living Water. -On the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood up and cried out,“If anyone is thirsty,let him come to me and drink.

38.verse: Whoever believes in me,as Scripture has said,‘Streams of living watershall flow from within him.’ ”

39.verse: Now he was referring here to the Spirit whom those who believed in him were to receive. As yet the Spirit had not been bestowed because Jesus had not yet been glorified.

40.verse: People Are Divided concerning Jesus. -On hearing these words, some in the crowd said, “This must truly be the Prophet.”

41.verse: Others thought, “This is the Christ.” But still others retorted, “How can the Christ come from Galilee?

42.verse: Does not Scripture assert that the Christ will be of the seed of David and come from Bethlehem, the city where David lived?”

43.verse: As a result, the crowd was sharply divided because of him.

44.verse: Some of them even wanted to arrest him, but no one laid a hand on him.

45.verse: Then the temple guards went back to the chief priests and the Pharisees, who asked them, “Why did you not arrest him?”

46.verse: The guards answered, “No one has ever spoken as this man has.”

47.verse: Then the Pharisees said, “Have you also been deceived?

48.verse: Has any one of the authorities or of the Pharisees come to believe in him?

49.verse: As for this crowd, they do not know the Law—they are cursed.”

50.verse: One of them, Nicodemus, who had previously come to Jesus, said to them,

51.verse: “Does our Law allow us to pass judgment on someone without first giving him a hearing to ascertain what he is doing?”

52.verse: They replied, “Are you too a Galilean? Look it up, and you will find that no prophet is to arise from Galilee.”

53.verse: Chapter 8 -Jesus, Savior of Sinners -A Woman Caught in Adultery. - [7:53Then each of them returned home.

1.verse: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

2.verse: At daybreak he entered the temple courts, and all the people gathered around him. He sat down and began to teach them.

3.verse: The scribes and the Pharisees brought in a woman who had been caught in adultery. Forcing her to stand in their midst,

4.verse: they said to him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.

5.verse: Now in the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women. What do you have to say?”

6.verse: They asked him this question as a test so that they could bring a charge against him. Jesus bent down and started to write on the ground with his finger.

7.verse: When they continued to persist in their question, he straightened up and said to them, “Let anyone among you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her.”

8.verse: Then he again bent down and wrote on the ground.

9.verse: When they heard his response, they went away one by one, beginning with the elders, until Jesus was left alone with the woman standing before him.

10.verse: Then Jesus straightened up and said to her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one condemned you?”

11.verse: She replied, “No one, sir.” “Neither do I condemn you,” Jesus said. “Go on your way, and sin no more.”]

12.verse: The Light Triumphs over Darkness -The Light of the World. -Jesus addressed them once again, saying,“I am the light of the world.The one who follows mewill never walk in darkness.Rather, he will have the light of life.”

13.verse: On hearing this, the Pharisees said to him, “You are testifying on your own behalf. Your testimony is not true.”

14.verse: Jesus replied,“Even though I testify on my own behalf,my testimony is true,because I know where I have come fromand where I am going,whereas you do not knowwhere I have come fromor where I am going.

15.verse: You judge by the flesh,whereas I do not judge anyone.

16.verse: Yet even if I do judge,my judgment is truebecause it is not I alone who judge,but it is I and the Father who sent me.

17.verse: “In your Law it is writtenthat the testimony of two witnesses is true.

18.verse: I testify on my own behalf,and the Father who sent mealso testifies on my behalf.”

19.verse: They continued to question him, saying, “Where is your Father?” Jesus answered,“You know neither me nor my Father.If you knew me,you would know my Father also.”

20.verse: He spoke these words while he was teaching at the treasury of the temple. However, no one arrested him because his hour had not yet come.

21.verse: I AM! -Again he said to them,“I am going away,and you will search for mebut you will die in your sin.Where I am going, you cannot come.”

22.verse: Then the Jews wondered, “Is he planning to kill himself—because he was saying, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come’?”

23.verse: He continued,“You belong to what is below,whereas I belong to what is above.You belong to this world,but I am not of this world.

24.verse: That is why I told youthat you would die in your sins.For if you do not believethat I AM,you will die in your sins.”

25.verse: “Who are you then?” they asked him. Jesus answered,“Just what I have been telling youfrom the beginning.

26.verse: I have much to say about you,and much to condemn.But the one who sent me is true,and what I have heard from himI declare to the world.”

27.verse: They did not understand that he was speaking to them about the Father.

28.verse: Therefore, Jesus said,“When you have lifted up the Son of Man,then you will knowthat I AM,that I do nothing on my own authorityand I say nothing except whatthe Father has taught me.

29.verse: He who sent me is with me.He has not left me alone,for I always do what pleases him.”

30.verse: On hearing these words, many came to believe in him.

31.verse: Jesus and Abraham. -Then Jesus said to those Jews who did believe in him,“If you remain faithful to my word,you will truly be my disciples.

32.verse: You will know the truth,and the truth will set you free.”

33.verse: They answered him, “We are descendants of Abraham, and we have never been slaves to anyone. What do you mean by saying, ‘You will be set free’?”

34.verse: Jesus replied,“Amen, amen, I say to you,everyone who sinsis a slave of sin.

35.verse: A slave does not remain in a household forever,but a son remains in it forever.

36.verse: Therefore, if the Son sets you free,you then will truly be free.

37.verse: “I know that you are descendants of Abraham,but you seek to kill mebecause my word has no place in your heart.

38.verse: I speak of what I have seenin my Father’s presence,whereas you do what you have heardfrom your father.”

39.verse: The Jews said to him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them,“If you were Abraham’s children,you would be doing the works that Abraham did.

40.verse: But now you seek to kill me,a man who has told you the truththat I heard from God.This is not what Abraham did.

41.verse: You are doing the works of your father!”They retorted, “We are not illegitimate children. We have one father—God.”

42.verse: Jesus said to them,“If God were your father,you would love me,for I came from God;neither did I come of my own will,but he was the one who sent me.

43.verse: Why do you not understandwhat I am saying?It is because you cannot bearto hear my words.

44.verse: “You are from your father, the devil,and you choose to carry out your father’s desires.He was a murderer from the beginning,and he does not abide by the truth,for there is no truth in him.When he lies,he speaks in accord with his own nature,for he is a liarand the father of lies.

45.verse: But because I speak the truthyou refuse to believe me.

46.verse: “Which of you can convict me of sin?If I say what is true,why do you not believe me?

47.verse: Whoever comes from Godlistens to the words of God.The reason why you refuse to listenis that you do not belong to God.”

48.verse: The Jews answered, “Are we not right in saying that you are a Samaritan and are possessed?”

49.verse: Jesus said,“I am not possessed.I honor my Father,but you dishonor me.

50.verse: I do not seek my own glory.There is one who seeks it,and he is the judge.

51.verse: Amen, amen, I say to you,whoever keeps my wordwill never see death.”

52.verse: The Jews retorted, “Now we are positive that you are possessed. Abraham died, and the Prophets are dead. Yet you say, ‘Whoever keeps my word will never taste death.’

53.verse: Are you greater than our father Abraham? He is dead, and the Prophets are also dead. Who do you claim to be?”

54.verse: Jesus answered,“If I glorify myself,that glory is of no value.It is my Father who glorifies me,the one about whom you say,‘He is our God,’

55.verse: even though you do not know him.However, I do know him.If I would saythat I do not know him,I would be a liar like you.But I do know him,and I keep his word.

56.verse: Your father Abraham rejoicedthat he would see my day.He saw it and was glad.”

57.verse: The Jews then said to him, “You are not yet fifty years old. How can you have seen Abraham?”

58.verse: Jesus responded,“Amen, amen, I say to you,before Abraham was,I AM.”

59.verse: Then they picked up stones to throw at him, but he hid himself and left the temple.

1.verse: A Sign of the Triumph of the Light -Chapter 9 -Jesus Cures a Man Born Blind. -As Jesus walked along, he saw a man who had been blind from birth.

2.verse: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”

3.verse: Jesus answered,“Neither this man nor his parents sinned,but it happenedso that the works of Godmight be revealed in him.

4.verse: We must dothe works of him who sent mewhile it is still day.Night is coming when no one can work.

5.verse: While I am in the world,I am the light of the world.”

6.verse: When he had said this, he spat on the ground, made a paste with the saliva, and smeared the paste on the eyes of the blind man.

7.verse: Then he said to him, “Go and wash in the Pool of Siloam.” (The name means “Sent.”) The man went forth and washed, and he returned seeing.

8.verse: That Man Is a Prophet. -His neighbors and those who had seen him begging asked, “Is this not the man who used to sit and beg?”

9.verse: Some were saying, “Yes, this is the same man,” but others insisted, “No. It simply is someone who looks like him.” He said, “I am the man.”

10.verse: Therefore, they asked him, “Then how were your eyes opened?”

11.verse: He replied, “The man called Jesus made a paste and smeared it over my eyes. Then he said to me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash.’ So I went and washed, and then I was able to see.”

12.verse: They asked him, “Where is he?” He replied, “I do not know.”

13.verse: They then brought the man who had formerly been blind to the Pharisees.

14.verse: Now it was on a Sabbath day that Jesus had made the paste and opened his eyes.

15.verse: The Pharisees also asked him how he had gained his sight. He said to them, “He put a paste on my eyes. Then I washed, and now I can see.”

16.verse: Some of the Pharisees said, “This man cannot be from God, for he does not observe the Sabbath.” But others said, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs?” Thus, they were divided in their opinions.

17.verse: And so they spoke again to the blind man, asking, “What do you have to say about him? It was your eyes that he opened.” He replied, “He is a prophet.”

18.verse: However, the Jews refused to believe that the man had been blind and had received his sight until they summoned the parents of the man who had received his sight

19.verse: and asked them, “Is this your son who you say was born blind? How then is he now able to see?”

20.verse: His parents answered, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind,

21.verse: but we do not know how he is now able to see, nor do we know who opened his eyes. Ask him. He is of age. He can speak for himself.”

22.verse: His parents responded in this way because they were afraid of the Jews. For the Jews had already agreed that anyone who acknowledged Jesus to be the Christ would be put out of the synagogue.

23.verse: This is why his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”

24.verse: That Man Is from God. -And so for a second time they summoned the man who had been blind and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.”

25.verse: He answered, “I do not know whether he is a sinner. But one thing I do know: I was blind, and now I am able to see.”

26.verse: They then asked him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”

27.verse: He answered them, “I have told you already and you would not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become his disciples?”

28.verse: Then they began to taunt him, saying, “It is you who are his disciple. We are disciples of Moses.

29.verse: We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this man, we do not know where he is from.”

30.verse: He answered, “That is what is so amazing. You do not know where he comes from, and yet he opened my eyes.

31.verse: We know that God does not listen to sinners, but that he does listen to anyone who is devout and obeys his will.

32.verse: “Never since the world began has it been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person born blind.

33.verse: If this man were not from God, he could not have been able to accomplish anything.”

34.verse: They answered him, “You were born in sin and you would teach us?” Then they threw him out.

35.verse: Do You Believe in the Son of Man? -When Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, he found him and asked, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”

36.verse: He replied, “Who is he, sir, so that I may believe in him?”

37.verse: “You have seen him,” said Jesus, “and he is the one who is speaking to you.”

38.verse: He said, “I do believe, Lord,” and he fell down in worship before him.

39.verse: Spiritual Blindness. -Then Jesus said,“It is for judgmentthat I have come into this world,so that those without sight may seeand those who do see may become blind.”

40.verse: On hearing this, some Pharisees who were present asked him, “Are we blind too?”

41.verse: Jesus replied,“If you were blind,you would have no guilt;but since you claim, ‘We see,’your guilt remains.

1.verse: The Shepherd Who Gives Up His Life -I Am the Good Shepherd -Chapter 10 -The Good Shepherd -“Amen, amen, I say to you,anyone who does not enterthe sheepfold through the gatebut climbs in some other wayis a thief and a bandit.

2.verse: The one who enters through the gateis the shepherd of the flock.

3.verse: The gatekeeper opens for him,and the sheep hear his voice.He calls his own sheep by nameand leads them out.

4.verse: “When he has brought out all his own,he goes on ahead of them,and the sheep follow himbecause they know his voice.

5.verse: However, they will never follow a stranger.Rather, they will run away from him,because they do not recognizethe voice of strangers.”

6.verse: Jesus used this parable to instruct them, but they did not understand what he was saying to them.

7.verse: Therefore, Jesus spoke to them again,“Amen, amen, I say to you,I am the gate of the sheepfold.

8.verse: All who came before mewere thieves and bandits,but the sheep did not listen to them.

9.verse: “I am the gate.Anyone who enters through mewill be saved.He will go in and outand will find pasture.

10.verse: “A thief comes onlyto steal and kill and destroy.I have comethat they may have life,and have it in abundance.

11.verse: “I am the good shepherd.The good shepherdlays down his life for the sheep.

12.verse: The hired hand,who is not the shepherdnor the owner of the sheep,sees the wolf approaching,and he leaves the sheep and runs away,while the wolf catches and scatters them.

13.verse: He runs awaybecause he is only a hired handand he has no concern for the sheep.

14.verse: “I am the good shepherd.I know my own,and my own know me,

15.verse: just as the Father knows meand I know the Father.And I lay down my life for the sheep.

16.verse: “I have other sheep toothat do not belong to this fold.I must lead them as well,and they will hear my voice.Thus, there will only be one flock,one shepherd.

17.verse: “This is why the Father loves me,because I lay down my lifein order to take it up again.

18.verse: No one takes it away from me.I lay it down of my own free will.And as I have the power to lay it down,I have the power to take it up again.This command I have received from my Father.”

19.verse: Once again, these words provoked a division among the Jews.

20.verse: Many of them were saying, “He is possessed and out of his mind. Why should we listen to him?”

21.verse: But others said, “No one possessed by a demon could speak like this. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”

22.verse: I and the Father Are One -Feast of the Dedication. -At that time, the feast of the Dedication was taking place in Jerusalem. It was winter,

23.verse: and Jesus was walking in the temple along the Portico of Solomon.

24.verse: The Jews gathered around him and asked, “How much longer will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

25.verse: Jesus replied,“I have told you,but you do not believe.The works that I do in my Father’s namebear witness to me,

26.verse: but you do not believebecause you are not my sheep.

27.verse: “My sheep listen to my voice.I know them, and they follow me.

28.verse: I give them eternal life,and they will never perish.No one will ever snatch them from my hand.

29.verse: My Father who has given them to meis greater than all,and no one can snatch themout of the Father’s hand.

30.verse: I and the Father are one.”

31.verse: Once again, the Jews picked up rocks to stone him,

32.verse: but Jesus said to them, “I have performed in your presence many good works from my Father. For which of these works are you going to stone me?”

33.verse: The Jews answered, “We are not going to stone you for any good work you have done, but for blasphemy. Even though you are a man, you are claiming to be God.”

34.verse: Jesus replied,“Is it not written in your Law,‘I said: You are gods’?

35.verse: If those to whomthe word of God was addressedare called ‘gods’—and Scripture cannot be set aside—

36.verse: how can you say, ‘You blaspheme,’to the one whom the Father has consecratedand sent into the worldfor saying, ‘I am the Son of God’?

37.verse: “If I am not performingthe works of my Father,then do not believe me.

38.verse: However, if I am doing them,then even if you do not believe me,at least believe my works,so that you may realize and understandthat the Father is in meand I am in the Father.”

39.verse: They again tried to seize him, but he escaped from their clutches.

40.verse: The Testimony of John the Baptist. -He went back across the Jordan to the place where John had first been baptizing, and he remained there.

41.verse: Many people came to him, and they were saying, “John performed no sign, but everything that John said about this man was true.”

42.verse: And many there came to believe in him.

1.verse: I Am the Resurrection -Chapter 11 -Death of Lazarus. -In Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha, a certain man named Lazarus had fallen ill.

2.verse: This Mary was the woman who had anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped his feet with her hair. It was her brother Lazarus who was ill.

3.verse: And so the sisters sent this message to him, “Lord, the one you love is ill.”

4.verse: When Jesus heard this, he said,“This illness is not to end in death.Rather, it is for God’s glory,so that by means of itthe Son of Man may be glorified.”

5.verse: Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

6.verse: So after learning that Lazarus was ill, he remained for two more days in the place where he was.

7.verse: Then he said to his disciples, “Let us return to Judea.”

8.verse: His disciples said to him, “Rabbi, just a short time ago the Jews were trying to stone you. Why do you want to go back there?”

9.verse: Jesus answered,“Are there not twelve hours of daylight?If someone walks in the daylight,he does not stumble,because he sees by the light of this world.

10.verse: But if he walks at night,he stumbles,because he does not have the light.”

11.verse: After saying this, he went on to tell them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going there to awaken him.”

12.verse: The disciples responded, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.”

13.verse: Jesus, however, had been speaking about the death of Lazarus, but they thought that he was speaking of ordinary sleep.

14.verse: Finally, Jesus told them in plain words, “Lazarus is dead.

15.verse: I am glad for your sake that I was not there, so that you may believe. Let us go to him.”

16.verse: Then Thomas (who was called “the Twin”) said to his fellow disciples, “Let us also go so that we may die with him.”

17.verse: The Kingdom and the Promise of the Resurrection. -When Jesus arrived, he learned that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.

18.verse: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about two miles distant,

19.verse: and many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary to console them for the loss of their brother.

20.verse: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went forth to meet him, while Mary remained at home.

21.verse: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.

22.verse: But even now I know that God will grant you whatever you ask of him.”

23.verse: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”

24.verse: Martha replied, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day.”

25.verse: Jesus then said to her,“I am the resurrection and the life.Whoever believes in me,even though he dies, will live,

26.verse: and everyone who livesand believes in mewill never die.Do you believe this?”

27.verse: “Yes, Lord,” she replied. “I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, the one who is to come into the world.”

28.verse: When she had said this, she went back and took her sister Mary aside, telling her privately, “The Teacher is here and is asking for you.”

29.verse: As soon as she heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.

30.verse: For Jesus had not yet come to the village, but was still at the place where Martha had met him.

31.verse: When the Jews who were in the house consoling her saw Mary get up quickly and go out, they followed her, assuming that she was going to the tomb to weep there.

32.verse: Mary came to the place where Jesus was, and as soon as she saw him, she fell at his feet and said to him, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”

33.verse: When Jesus saw her weeping, and beheld the Jews who were with her also weeping, he became deeply moved in spirit and angry.

34.verse: He asked, “Where have you laid him?” They said to him, “Lord, come and see.”

36.verse: causing the Jews to say, “See how greatly he loved him!”

37.verse: But some of them remarked, “He opened the eyes of the blind man. Why could he not have done something to prevent this man’s death?”

38.verse: Again deeply moved, Jesus came to the tomb. It was a cave, with a stone closing the entrance.

39.verse: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the dead man’s sister, said to him, “Lord, by now there will be a stench, for he has been dead for four days.”

40.verse: Jesus replied, “Did I not tell you that if you have faith you will see the glory of God?”

41.verse: And so they removed the stone. Then Jesus looked up and said,“Father, I thank you for hearing me.

42.verse: I know that you always hear me,but I have said thisfor the sake of the people standing here,so that they may believethat it was you who sent me.”

43.verse: When he had said this, he cried out in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”

44.verse: The dead man came out, his hands and feet bound with linen bands, and his face wrapped in a cloth. Then Jesus said to them, “Untie him and let him go free.”

45.verse: One Man Must Die for the People. -This caused many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary, and had seen what Jesus did, to believe in him.

46.verse: However, some of them went to the Pharisees and reported to them what Jesus had done.

47.verse: As a result, the chief priests and the Pharisees summoned a meeting of the Sanhedrin and said, “What are we going to do? This man is performing many signs.

48.verse: If we let him go on like this, everyone will start to believe in him, and then the Romans will come and suppress both our temple and our nation.”

49.verse: However, one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all.

50.verse: You do not seem to realize that it is better for us that one man die for the people rather than the whole nation be destroyed.”

51.verse: He did not say this on his own, but as the high priest that year he was prophesying that Jesus was to die for the nation,

52.verse: and not for the nation alone, but to gather into one the dispersed children of God.

53.verse: And so from that day on, they plotted to kill him.

54.verse: As a result, Jesus no longer walked about openly among the Jews. He withdrew to a town called Ephraim in the region bordering the desert, and he remained there with the disciples.

55.verse: The True Passover That Brings About the Salvation of Humankind -The Hour Has Come -The Last Passover. -Now the Jewish Passover was drawing near, and many people went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover in order to purify themselves.

56.verse: They kept looking for Jesus, and they asked one another as they stood in the temple, “What do you think? Will he come to the feast or not?”

57.verse: Meanwhile, the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who knew where he was should inform them so that they might arrest him.

1.verse: Chapter 12 -The Anointing at Bethany. -Six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, the hometown of Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

2.verse: They gave a dinner there for him. Martha served the meal, and Lazarus was among those at table with him.

3.verse: Mary brought in a pint of very costly ointment, made from pure nard, anointed Jesus’ feet, and dried them with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.

4.verse: Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, the one who was about to betray him, said,

5.verse: “Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii and the money given to the poor?”

6.verse: He said this not because he had any concern for the poor but because he was a thief. He was in charge of the money bag, and he used to steal from it.

7.verse: Jesus said in response, “Leave her alone! Let her keep it for the day of my burial.

8.verse: The poor you will always have with you, but you will not always have me.”

9.verse: Meanwhile, a large number of Jews learned that he was there, and they came not only because of Jesus but also because they wanted to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

10.verse: The chief priests then decided to put Lazarus to death as well,

11.verse: since it was because of him that many of the Jews were leaving and putting their faith in Jesus.

12.verse: The Triumphal Entry into Jerusalem. -The next day the great crowd of people who had come for the feast heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.

13.verse: Thus, they went out to meet him, carrying branches of palm and shouting,“Hosanna!Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord,the King of Israel.”

14.verse: Jesus found a young donkey and rode it, as it is written,

15.verse: “Do not be afraid, daughter of Zion.Behold, your King is coming,riding on a donkey’s colt.”

16.verse: At first, his disciples did not understand this, but later, when Jesus had been glorified, they recalled that these things had been written about him and had happened to him.

17.verse: Now the people who had been present when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to testify about this.

18.verse: Because the crowd had heard that he had performed this sign, they went out to meet him.

19.verse: So the Pharisees said to one another, “As you see, we are getting nowhere. The entire world has gone after him.”

20.verse: The Glory of the Cross. -Among those who had come up to worship at the feast were some Greeks.

21.verse: They approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and said to him, “Sir, we would like to see Jesus.

22.verse: Philip went to tell Andrew of this, and Philip and Andrew informed Jesus.

23.verse: Jesus answered them,“The hour has comefor the Son of Man to be glorified.

24.verse: Amen, amen, I say to you,unless a grain of wheatfalls into the earth and dies,it remains just a grain of wheat.However, if it dies,it bears much fruit.

25.verse: “Anyone who loves his life loses it,but the one who hates his life in this worldwill preserve it for eternal life.

26.verse: If anyone wishes to serve me,he must follow me.Where I am,there also will my servant be.If anyone serves me,my Father will honor that person.

27.verse: “Now my soul is troubled.Yet what should I say:‘Father, save me from this hour’?No, it was for thisthat I have come to this hour.

28.verse: Father, glorify your name.”Then a voice came from heaven,“I have glorified it,and I will glorify it again.”

29.verse: The crowd that was present heard this, and some of them said that it was thunder, while others asserted, “An angel has spoken to him.”

30.verse: Jesus answered,“This voice did not come for my sakebut for yours.

31.verse: Now is the judgment on this world.Now the prince of this worldwill be driven out.

32.verse: And when I am lifted up from the earth,I will draw all to myself.”

33.verse: He said this to indicate the kind of death he was to die.

34.verse: The crowd answered, “Our Law teaches that the Christ will remain forever. How then can you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?”

35.verse: Jesus replied,“The light will be with youfor only a little longer.Go on your waywhile you still have the light,so that the darknesswill not overtake you.“Whoever walks in the darknessdoes not know where he is going.

36.verse: While you have the light,believe in the lightso that you may become children of light.”After Jesus had said this, he departed and hid himself from their sight.

37.verse: The Choice To Believe in the Light. -Although he had performed so many signs in their presence, they did not believe in him.

38.verse: This was to fulfill the word of the prophet Isaiah,“Lord, who has believed our preaching?To whom has the power of the Lord been revealed?”

39.verse: They therefore could not believe for as Isaiah said,

40.verse: “He has blinded their eyesand hardened their hearts,lest they see with their eyesand understand with their hearts,and thereby be converted,so that I could heal them.”

41.verse: Isaiah said this because he saw his glory, and his words referred to him.

42.verse: Nevertheless, there were many, even among the authorities, who believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess their faith in him, for fear of being banned from the synagogue.

43.verse: For they valued human glory more highly than the glory that comes from God.

44.verse: The Choice To Believe in Jesus. -Then Jesus cried out,“Whoever believes in mebelieves not only in mebut in him who sent me.

45.verse: And whoever sees mesees the one who sent me.

46.verse: I have come into the world as lightso that everyone who believes in memay not have to remain in darkness.

47.verse: “But if anyone listens to my wordsand fails to observe them,I will not pass judgment on him,for I did not come to judge the worldbut to save the world.

48.verse: Anyone who rejects meand does not accept my wordsalready has a judge.On the last day,the word that I have spokenwill serve as his judge.

49.verse: “For I have not spoken on my own,but the Father who sent mehas himself given me commandabout what I am to sayand how I am to speak.

50.verse: I know that his commandmentis eternal life.Therefore, what I speakis what the Father has told me to say.”

1.verse: The Testament of the Lord -Chapter 13 -Jesus Washes the Feet of the Disciples. -As the feast of Passover drew near, Jesus was aware that his hour had come to depart from this world and to go to the Father. He had loved his own who were in the world, and he loved them to the end.

2.verse: The devil had already put it into the mind of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus. During supper,

3.verse: Jesus, fully aware that the Father had entrusted all things into his hands, and that he had come from God and was returning to God,

4.verse: got up from the table, removed his outer garments, and took a towel that he tied around his waist.

5.verse: Then he poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel wrapped around his waist.

6.verse: He came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”

7.verse: Jesus answered, “You do not understand now what I am doing, but later you will understand.”

8.verse: Peter said to him, “You shall never wash my feet.” Jesus replied, “Unless I wash you, you will have no share with me.”

9.verse: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, then wash not only my feet, but also my hands and my head.”

10.verse: Jesus then said, “Anyone who has bathed has no need to wash further, except for his feet, for he is clean all over. You also are clean, although not every one of you is clean.”

11.verse: He knew the one who was going to betray him. That is why he added the words, “Not every one of you is clean.”

12.verse: After he had finished washing their feet and had once again put on his outer garments, he reclined at table and said to them,“Do you understandwhat I have done for you?

13.verse: You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’and rightly so,for that is what I am.

14.verse: So if I, your Lord and Teacher,have washed your feet,you also should wash one another’s feet.

15.verse: “I have given you an example.What I have done for you,you should also do.

16.verse: Amen, amen, I say to you,a servant is not greater than his master,nor is a messenger greaterthan the one who sent him.

17.verse: “Now that you know these things,you will be blessedif you do them.

18.verse: Jesus Predicts His Betrayal -“I am not speaking about all of you.I know those whom I have chosen.However, what the Scripture saysmust be fulfilled,‘The one who ate bread with mehas raised his heel against me.’

19.verse: “I tell you this now,before it occurs,so that when it does occur,you may believe that I am.

20.verse: Amen, amen, I say to you,whoever receives the one I sendreceives me,and whoever receives mereceives the one who sent me.”

21.verse: After saying this, Jesus was deeply distressed, and he declared,“Amen, amen, I say to you,one of you will betray me.”

22.verse: The disciples looked at one another, puzzled as to which one of them he meant.

23.verse: One of them, the disciple whom Jesus loved, was reclining at Jesus’ side.

24.verse: Simon Peter signaled to him to ask Jesus which one he meant.

25.verse: Therefore, leaning back toward Jesus, he asked, “Lord, who is it?”

26.verse: Jesus answered, “It is the one to whom I give this piece of bread after I have dipped it into the dish.” And when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, son of Simon Iscariot.

27.verse: As soon as Judas had received the piece of bread, Satan entered into him. Jesus then said to him, “Do quickly what you are going to do.”

28.verse: Now no one at the table knew why he had said this to him.

29.verse: Some thought that since Judas was in charge of the money bag, Jesus was telling him to purchase what was needed for the feast, or to give something to the poor.

30.verse: As soon as Judas had received the piece of bread, he immediately departed. It was night.

31.verse: After Judas had departed, Jesus said,“Now is the Son of Man glorified,and God is glorified in him.

32.verse: If God is glorified in him,God will also glorify him in himself,and he will glorify him at once.

33.verse: A New Commandment -“My children,I will be with youonly a short time longer.You will look for me,and, as I told the Jews,so I now say to you,‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’

34.verse: “I give you a new commandment:love one another.Just as I have loved you,so you should also love one another.

35.verse: This is how everyone will knowthat you are my disciples:if you love one another.”

36.verse: Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial. -Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered,“Where I am going,you cannot follow me now,but you will follow me later on.”

37.verse: Peter said, “Lord, why can I not follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”

38.verse: Jesus answered, “Will you really lay down your life for me? Amen, amen, I say to you, before the cock crows, you will have denied me three times.

1.verse: The Way, the Truth, and the Life -Chapter 14 -Jesus, the Way, Leads to the Father -“Do not let your hearts be troubled.You place your trust in God.Trust also in me.

2.verse: In my Father’s housethere are many dwelling places.If there were not,would I have told youthat I am going to prepare a place for you?

3.verse: And if I go and prepare a place for you,I will come againand will take you to myself,so that where I am,you may also be.

4.verse: You know the wayto the place I am going.”

5.verse: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we do not know where you are going. How can we know the way?”

6.verse: Jesus, the Truth, Reveals the Father -Jesus replied,“I am the way, and the truth, and the life.No one comes to the Fatherexcept through me.

7.verse: If you know me,then you will know my Father also.From now on you do know him.You have seen him.”

8.verse: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, it will be enough for us.”

9.verse: Jesus answered,“Have I been with you all this time, Philip,and you still do not know me?Whoever has seen mehas seen the Father.How can you say,‘Show us the Father’?

10.verse: Do you not believethat I am in the Fatherand the Father is in me?“The words that I speak to youI do not speak on my own.The Father who dwells in meis doing his works.

11.verse: Believe me when I saythat I am in the Fatherand the Father is in me.But if you do not,then believebecause of the works themselves.

12.verse: Jesus, the Life, Communicates the Spirit -“Amen, amen, I say to you,the one who believes in mewill also do the works that I do,and indeed will do even greater ones than these,because I am going to the Father.

13.verse: Whatever you ask in my name I will do,so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

14.verse: If you ask me for anything in my name,I will do it.

15.verse: “If you love me,you will keep my commandments.

16.verse: And I will ask the Father,and he will give you another Advocateto be with you forever,

17.verse: the Spirit of Truthwhom the world cannot acceptbecause it neither sees him nor knows him.But you know him,because he dwells with youand will be in you.

18.verse: “I will not leave you orphans;I will come to you.

19.verse: In a little while,the world will no longer see me,but you will see me.Because I live,you also will live.

20.verse: On that day, you will knowthat I am in my Father,and you in me, and I in you.

21.verse: “Anyone who has received my commandmentsand observes themis the one who loves me.And whoever loves mewill be loved by my Father,and I will love himand reveal myself to him.”

22.verse: Judas (not Judas Iscariot) asked him, “Lord, why is it that you are revealing yourself to us and not to the world?”

23.verse: Jesus answered him,“Whoever loves me will keep my word,and my Father will love him,and we will come to himand make our abode with him.

24.verse: Whoever does not love medoes not keep my words.And the word that you hearis not my own,but that of the Father who sent me.

25.verse: “I have told you these thingswhile I am still with you.

26.verse: However, the Advocate, the Holy Spirit,whom the Father will send in my name,will teach you everythingand remind you of allthat I have said to you.

27.verse: The Peace of Jesus -“Peace I leave with you,my peace I give to you.Not as the world givesdo I give it to you.Do not let your hearts be troubled;be not afraid.

28.verse: “You have heard me say to you,‘I am going away,and I will come back to you.’If you loved me,you would rejoicethat I am going to the Father,for the Father is greater than I.

29.verse: And now I have told you thisbefore it happens,so that when it does happenyou may believe.

30.verse: “I will no longer talk at length with youbecause the prince of the world is coming.He has no power over me,

31.verse: but the world must come to understandthat I love the Fatherand that I dojust as the Father has commanded me.Get up! Let us be on our way.

1.verse: The Community of the Witnesses to Christ -Chapter 15 -Union with Jesus -“I am the true vine,and my Father is the vinegrower.

2.verse: He removes every branchthat does not bear fruit,and every branch that doeshe prunes to make it bear even more.
