3.verse: You have already been cleansedby the word I have spoken to you.

4.verse: “Abide in me,as I abide in you.Just as a branch cannot bear fruit by itselfunless it abides in the vine,so you cannot bear fruitunless you abide in me.

5.verse: “I am the vine,you are the branches.Whoever abides in me, and I in him,will bear much fruit.Apart from me you can do nothing.

6.verse: Whoever does not abide in mewill be thrown away like a withered branch.Such branches are gathered up,thrown into the fire, and burned.

7.verse: “If you abide in meand my words abide in you,you may ask for whatever you wish,and it will be done for you.

8.verse: By this is my Father glorified,that you bear much fruitand become my disciples.

9.verse: “As the Father has loved me,so have I loved you.Remain in my love.

10.verse: If you keep my commandments,you will remain in my love,just as I have kept my Father’s commandmentsand remain in his love.

11.verse: “I have told you these thingsso that my joy may be in youand your joy may be complete.

12.verse: Love as Jesus Does -“This is my commandment:love one anotheras I have loved you.

13.verse: No one can have greater lovethan to lay down his life for his friends.

14.verse: You are my friendsif you do what I command you.

15.verse: “I shall no longer call you servants,because a servant does not knowwhat his master is doing.I have called you friendsbecause I have revealed to youeverything that I have heard from my Father.

16.verse: “You did not choose me.Rather, I chose you.And I appointed youto go out and bear fruit,fruit that will remain,so that the Father may give youwhatever you ask him in my name.

17.verse: The command I give you is this:love one another.

18.verse: Witnesses to Jesus in the Face of the World’s Hatred -“If the world hates you,be aware that it hated mebefore it hated you.

19.verse: If you belonged to the world,the world would love you as its own.But you do not belong to the worldbecause I have chosen you out of the world,and therefore the world hates you.

20.verse: “Remember the word that I said to you:‘a servant is not greater than his master.’If they persecuted me,they will persecute you.If they kept my word,they will keep yours as well.

21.verse: But they will do all these things to youon account of my name,because they do not know the one who sent me.

22.verse: “If I had not comeand spoken to them,they would not be guilty of sin,but now they have no excuse for their sin.

23.verse: Whoever hates mehates my Father also.

24.verse: If I had not done works among themthat no one else had ever done,they would not be guilty of sin.But now they have seen and hatedboth me and my Father.

25.verse: All this was to fulfill the wordthat is inscribed in their Law:‘They hated me without cause.’

26.verse: “When the Advocate comeswhom I will send you from the Father,the Spirit of truth who comes from the Father,he will testify on my behalf.

27.verse: And you also are my witnessesbecause you have been with me from the beginning.

1.verse: Chapter 16 -“I have told you thisto prevent you from falling away.

2.verse: They will expel you from the synagogues.Indeed the hour is comingwhen anyone who kills youwill believe that by doing sohe is serving God.

3.verse: And people will do such thingsbecause they have not known the Father or me.

4.verse: But I have told you thisso that when the hour arrivesyou may remember that I forewarned you about them.The Spirit of Truth, Our Guide to All Truth -“I did not tell you all this previouslybecause I was with you.

5.verse: But now I am going awayto the one who sent me.Not one of you asks me,‘Where are you going?’

6.verse: However, because I have told you this,you are overcome with grief.

7.verse: “Nevertheless, I am telling you the truth:it is better for you that I depart.For if I do not go away,the Advocate will not come to you,whereas if I go,I will send him to you.

8.verse: “And when he comes,he will prove the world wrongabout sin and righteousness and judgment:

9.verse: about sin,because they do not believe in me;

10.verse: about righteousness,because I am going to the Fatherand you will see me no longer;

11.verse: about judgment,because the ruler of this world has been condemned.

12.verse: “I have much more to tell you,but you would not be able to bear it now.

13.verse: But when the Spirit of truth comes,he will guide you into all the truth.He will not speak on his own authority,but he will speak what he hears,and he will declare to youthe things that are coming.

14.verse: He will glorify me,for he will take what is mineand communicate it to you.

15.verse: Everything that the Father has is mine.That is why I saidthat he will take what is mineand communicate it to you.

16.verse: Triumph of Jesus and the Joy of the Witnesses -“In a little whileyou will no longer see me,and then a short time lateryou will see me again.”

17.verse: Then some of his disciples said to one another, “What does he mean by saying to us, ‘In a little while you will no longer see me, and then a short time later you will see me again,’ and ‘Because I am going to the Father’?

18.verse: What is this ‘little while’? We do not know what he means.”

19.verse: Jesus knew that they wanted to question him, so he said to them,“You are asking one anotherwhat I meant by saying,‘In a little whileyou will no longer see me,and then a short time lateryou will see me again.’

20.verse: Amen, amen, I say to you,you will weep and mournwhile the world rejoices.You will be sorrowful,but your grief will turn into joy.

21.verse: “A woman in labor suffers anguishbecause her hour has come.But when her baby is born,she no longer recalls the sufferingbecause of her joythat she has brought a child into the world.

22.verse: In the same way,you are now in anguish,but I will see you again,and your hearts will rejoice,and no one shall deprive you of your joy.

23.verse: “On that day,you will not ask me anything further.Amen, amen, I say to you,if you ask the Father for anything in my name,he will give it to you.

24.verse: Until now, in my name,you have not asked for anything.Ask and you will receive,so that your joy may be complete.

25.verse: “I have used figures of speechto explain these things to you.The hour is comingwhen I will no longer use figures,but I will tell you about the Father in plain words.

26.verse: When that day comes,you will make requests in my name.I do not saythat I will entreat the Father on your behalf.

27.verse: For the Father himself loves youbecause you have loved meand have come to believethat I came from God.

28.verse: I came from the Fatherand have come into the world.Now I am leaving the worldand returning to the Father.”

29.verse: “At last you are speaking plainly,” his disciples said, “and not using figures of speech.

30.verse: Now we realize that you know everything and do not need to have anyone question you. Because of this, we believe that you came from God.”

31.verse: Jesus responded,“Have you finally come to believe?

32.verse: I tell you, the hour is coming,indeed it has already come,when you will be scattered,each one going to his own home,and you will leave me alone.And yet I am not alonebecause the Father is with me.

33.verse: “I have told you thisso that in me you may be in peace.In the worldyou will endure suffering.But take courage!I have overcome the world.”

1.verse: The Priestly Prayer of Jesus -Chapter 17 -Knowledge of the Father and the Son. -After saying this, Jesus raised his eyes to heaven and said,“Father, the hour has come.Glorify your Son,so that your Son may glorify you,

2.verse: since you have given him authorityover all people,so that he may give eternal lifeto all those you have given him.

3.verse: And eternal life is this:to know you,the only true God,and the one you have sent,Jesus Christ.

4.verse: “I have glorified you on earthby completing the workthat you entrusted to me.

5.verse: So now, Father,glorify me in your presencewith the glory I had with youbefore the world began.

6.verse: The Son and the Disciples -“I have made your name knownto those whom you gave me from the world.They were yours,and you gave them to me,and they have kept your word.

7.verse: Now they have come to understandthat everything you gave me is from you.

8.verse: For the words you gave to meI have given to them,and they have accepted themand know with certaintythat I have come from you,and they have believed that you sent me.

9.verse: “It is for them that I pray.I do not pray for the world,but for those you gave mebecause they are yours

10.verse: Everything I have is yours,and everything you have is mine,and through them I have been glorified.

11.verse: I will remain no longer in the world,but they will still be in the worldwhile I will be coming to you.“Holy Father,protect by the power of your namethose you have given me,so that they may be one,even as we are one.

12.verse: While I was with themI protected them by your namethat you have given me,and I kept them safe.Not one of them was lost,except the one destined to be lost,so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

13.verse: “Now I am coming to you,and I say these thingswhile I am still in the worldso that my joy may cometo full measure in them.

14.verse: I have given them your word,and the world has hated thembecause they do not belong to the worldany more than I belong to the world.

15.verse: I am not asking youto take them out of the world,but I do ask youto protect them from the evil one.

16.verse: They do not belong to the worldany more than I belong to the world.

17.verse: “Consecrate them in the truth.Your word is truth.

18.verse: As you sent me into the world,so have I sent them into the world.

19.verse: And for their sakes I consecrate myself,so that they too may be consecrated in truth.

20.verse: The Disciples and the Church To Come -“I pray not only on behalf of these,but also for those who through their wordwill come to believe in me.

21.verse: May they all be one.As you, Father, are in meand I in you,may they also be in usso that the world may believethat you have sent me.

22.verse: “The glory that you have given meI have given to them,so that they may be one,as we are one,

23.verse: I in them and you in me,that they may become completely one,and thus the world may knowthat you have sent meand that you have loved themeven as you have loved me.

24.verse: “Father, allow those you have given meto be with me where I am,so that they may behold my glory,which you have bestowed on mebecause you loved mebefore the foundation of the world.

25.verse: “Righteous Father,the world has not known you;I have known you,and they have known that you have sent me.

26.verse: I have made your name known to them,and I will make it known,so that the love with which you loved memay be in them, and I in them.”

1.verse: The Passion—The Supreme Testimony -Chapter 18 -Jesus Gives Himself Up Freely. -After Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples and crossed the Kidron valley. He and his disciples entered a garden there.

2.verse: This place was known to Judas, his betrayer, because Jesus had often met there with his disciples.

3.verse: Therefore, Judas went to that garden with a detachment of soldiers, together with temple guards provided by the chief priests and the Pharisees, equipped with lanterns and torches and weapons.

4.verse: Then Jesus, fully aware of everything that was going to happen to him, came forward and asked them, “Whom are you looking for?”

5.verse: They answered, “Jesus the Nazorean.” Jesus replied, “I am.” Judas who betrayed him was standing with them.

6.verse: When Jesus said to them, “I am,” they drew back and fell to the ground.

7.verse: Again, he asked them, “Whom are you looking for?” And they said, “Jesus the Nazorean.”

8.verse: Jesus answered, “I have told you that I am. If you are looking for me, let these men go.”

9.verse: This was to fulfill the word he had spoken, “I did not lose any of those you gave me.”

10.verse: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, slicing off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.

11.verse: Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back into its scabbard! Am I not to drink the cup that the Father has given me?”

12.verse: Jesus and Peter at the Hour of Bearing Witness. -Then the detachment of soldiers, their commander, and the Jewish guards seized Jesus and bound him.

13.verse: They took him first to Annas, the father-in-law of Caiaphas who was the high priest that year.

14.verse: It was Caiaphas who had advised the Jews that it was better for one man to die for the people.

15.verse: Peter’s First Denial. -Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. That disciple was known to the high priest, so he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard,

16.verse: but Peter remained standing outside at the gate. The other disciple who was known to the high priest went out and spoke to the woman who was in charge of the gate, and he brought Peter inside.

17.verse: The woman said to Peter, “Are you not one of this man’s disciples?” He replied, “I am not.”

18.verse: Since it was cold, the servants and the guards had made a charcoal fire, and they were standing around it, warming themselves. Peter was also standing there and warming himself.

19.verse: The Inquiry before Annas. -The high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.

20.verse: Jesus answered,“I have spoken openlyfor the world to hear.I have always taughtin synagogues and in the templewhere all the Jews congregate.I have said nothing in secret.

21.verse: Why do you ask me?Interrogate those who heardwhat I said to them.They know what I said.”

22.verse: When he had said this, one of the temple guards standing there struck Jesus with his hand, saying, “Is that any way to answer the high priest?”

23.verse: Jesus replied, “If I have spoken wrongly, testify to my error. But if I have spoken rightly, why did you strike me?”

24.verse: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest.

25.verse: Peter’s Second and Third Denials. -Meanwhile, as Simon Peter stood warming himself, he was asked, “Are you not also one of his disciples?” He denied it and said, “I am not.”

26.verse: Then one of the servants of the high priest, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had sliced off, asked, “Did I not see you in the garden with him?”

27.verse: Again, Peter denied it. And at that very moment, a cock crowed.

28.verse: Jesus Handed Over to Pilate. -Then they took Jesus from Caiaphas to the praetorium. It was early in the morning, and they did not enter the praetorium in order to avoid becoming defiled and thus be able to eat the Passover meal.

29.verse: Therefore, Pilate went out to them and asked, “What charge do you bring against this man?”

30.verse: They answered, “If he were not a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you.”

31.verse: Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and judge him according to your law.” The Jews replied, “We are not allowed to put anyone to death.”

32.verse: This was to fulfill what Jesus had said when he indicated the kind of death he was to die.

33.verse: The First Hearing before Pilate. -Then Pilate went back into the praetorium, and having summoned Jesus he asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”

34.verse: Jesus answered, “Are you saying this on your own, or have others told you about me?”

35.verse: Pilate said, “Am I a Jew? Your own people and the chief priests have handed you over to me. What have you done?”

36.verse: Jesus replied,“My kingdom does not belong to this world.If my kingdom did belong to this world,my followers would have foughtto prevent me from being handed over to the Jews.The fact is that my kingdom is not here.”

37.verse: Pilate then said to him, “So you are a king!” Jesus answered,“It is you who saythat I am a king.For this was I born,and for this I came into the world:to testify to the truth.Everyone who is of the truthlistens to my voice.”

38.verse: Pilate responded, “What is truth?”Barabbas Preferred to Jesus. - Then, having said this, he went out again to the Jews and said, “I find no evidence of a crime in this man.

39.verse: But according to your custom, I release one prisoner to you at Passover. Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

40.verse: They shouted, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a thief.

1.verse: Chapter 19 -Behold, the Man! -Then Pilate ordered that Jesus be scourged.

2.verse: The soldiers twisted together some thorns into a crown and placed it on his head, and they dressed him in a purple robe.

3.verse: They kept going up to him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews,” while striking him on the face repeatedly.

4.verse: Once again, Pilate went out and said to the Jews, “Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no evidence of a crime in him.”

5.verse: Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Behold, the man!”

6.verse: When they saw him, the chief priests and the temple guards shouted, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and crucify him. I find no evidence of a crime in him.”

7.verse: The Jews answered, “We have a Law, and according to that Law he ought to die because he has claimed to be the Son of God.”

8.verse: The Second Hearing before Pilate. -Now when Pilate heard this, he was more frightened than ever.

9.verse: Returning to the praetorium, he asked Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus offered no response.

10.verse: Pilate then said to him, “Are you refusing to speak to me? Do you not realize that I have the power to release you and the power to crucify you?”

11.verse: Jesus answered him,“You would have no authority over me at allunless it had been given to you from above.Therefore, the one who handed me over to youis guilty of a greater sin.”

12.verse: Jesus Is Condemned to Death. -From that moment on, Pilate sought to release him, but the Jews kept shouting, “If you release this man, you are no Friend of Caesar. Everyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar.”

13.verse: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus out and seated him on the judge’s bench at a place known as the Stone Pavement (in Hebrew, “Gabbatha”).

14.verse: It was the day of Preparation for the Passover, and it was about noon. Pilate said to the Jews, “Behold, your King!”

15.verse: They shouted, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” “Am I to crucify your King?” Pilate asked them. The chief priests replied, “We have no king but Caesar.”

16.verse: Then he handed him over to them to be crucified.Jesus Is Crucified. - Then they took him away,

17.verse: and, carrying the cross by himself, he went out to what is called the Place of the Skull (in Hebrew, “Golgotha”).

18.verse: There they crucified him along with two others, one on either side, with Jesus in the middle.

19.verse: Pilate also had an inscription written and fastened to the cross. It read, “Jesus the Nazorean, King of the Jews.”

20.verse: This inscription, in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek, was read by many Jews, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city.

21.verse: Therefore, the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “You should not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but rather, ‘This man claimed to be the King of the Jews.’ ”

22.verse: Pilate responded, “What I have written, I have written.”

23.verse: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four shares, one share for each soldier. They also took his tunic, which was woven seamless, top to bottom.

24.verse: They said to one another, “Instead of tearing it, let us cast lots for it to see who is to get it.” In this way, the Scripture was fulfilled that says,“They divided my garments among them,and for my clothing they cast lots.”And that is what the soldiers did.

25.verse: Mary and John at the Cross. -Standing near the cross of Jesus were his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

26.verse: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing beside her, he said to his mother, “Woman, behold, your son.”

27.verse: Then he said to the disciple, “Behold, your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his home.

28.verse: Jesus Dies on the Cross. -After this, aware that everything had now been completed, and in order that the Scripture might be fulfilled, Jesus said, “I thirst.”

29.verse: A jar filled with sour wine was standing nearby, so they soaked a sponge in the wine on a branch of hyssop and held it up to his lips.

30.verse: When Jesus had taken the wine, he said, “It is finished.” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

31.verse: The Blood and the Water. -It was the day of Preparation, and the Jews did not want to have the bodies remain on the cross on the Sabbath, especially since that Sabbath day was a great solemnity. Therefore, they requested Pilate to order that their legs be broken and the bodies taken down.

32.verse: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and then of the other who had been crucified with him.

33.verse: However, when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs,

34.verse: but one of the soldiers thrust a lance into his side, and immediately a flow of blood and water came forth.

35.verse: An eyewitness has testified to this, and his testimony is true. He knows that what he says is true, so that you also may believe.

36.verse: This happened so that the Scripture might be fulfilled,“Not one of his bones will be broken.”

37.verse: And again, in another passage Scripture says,“They shall look on the onewhom they have pierced.”

38.verse: Jesus Is Buried. -Shortly thereafter, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly, because of his fear of the Jews, asked Pilate for permission to remove the body of Jesus. Pilate granted him permission, and so he came and took his body away.

39.verse: Nicodemus, who had first come to Jesus at night, also came, bringing with him a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about one hundred pounds.

40.verse: They took the body of Jesus and wrapped it with the spices in linen cloths, in accordance with the burial custom of the Jews.

41.verse: At the place where Jesus had been crucified there was a garden, and in that garden there was a new tomb in which no one had ever been buried.

42.verse: And so, since it was the Jewish day of Preparation and the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.

1.verse: The Appearances of the Risen One -Chapter 20 -The Mystery of the Empty Tomb. -Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been moved away from the tomb.

2.verse: Therefore, she ran to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him.”

3.verse: Then Peter and the other disciple set out and made their way toward the tomb.

4.verse: They both were running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.

5.verse: He bent down and saw the linen cloths lying there, but he did not go in.

6.verse: When Simon Peter caught up with him, he entered the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying there,

7.verse: and also the cloth that had covered his head not lying with the burial cloths but rolled up in a separate place.

8.verse: Then the other disciple who had reached the tomb first also went inside, and he saw and believed.

9.verse: They still did not understand the Scripture indicating that he must rise from the dead.

10.verse: Then the disciples returned to their homes.

11.verse: Mary Magdalene Recognizes Jesus. -Mary Magdalene remained weeping outside the tomb. And as she wept, she bent down to look into the tomb,

12.verse: and she saw two angels in white sitting there where the body of Jesus had been, one at the head and the other at the feet.

13.verse: They asked her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She answered, “They have taken my Lord away, and I do not know where they have put him.”

14.verse: As she said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus.

15.verse: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you looking for?” Thinking he was the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have removed him, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him away.”

16.verse: Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned and said to him in Hebrew, “Rabbouni!” (which means “Teacher”).

17.verse: Jesus then said to her, “Do not hold on to me, because I have not yet ascended to my Father. But go to my brethren and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’ ”

18.verse: Mary Magdalene then went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and repeated what he had said to her.

19.verse: Jesus Appears to the Disciples. -On the evening of that same day, the first day of the week, the doors of the house where the disciples had gathered were locked because of their fear of the Jews. Jesus then came and stood in their midst and said to them, “Peace be with you.”

20.verse: After saying this, he showed them his hands and his side.The disciples were filled with joy when they saw the Lord.

21.verse: “Peace be with you,” Jesus said to them again.“As the Father has sent me,so I send you.”

22.verse: After saying this, he breathed on them and said,“Receive the Holy Spirit.

23.verse: If you forgive anyone’s sins,they are forgiven.If you retain anyone’s sins,they are retained.”

24.verse: Jesus Appears to Thomas. -Now Thomas, called the Twin, who was one of the Twelve, was not with the rest when Jesus came.

25.verse: When the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord,” he replied, “Unless I see the mark of the nails on his hands and put my finger into the place where the nails pierced and insert my hand into his side, I will not believe.”

26.verse: Eight days later, the disciples were again in the house, and on this occasion Thomas was with them. Although the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood in their midst, and he said, “Peace be with you.”

27.verse: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here and see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Do not doubt any longer, but believe.”

28.verse: Thomas exclaimed, “My Lord and my God!”

29.verse: Then Jesus said to him,“You have come to believebecause you have seen me.Blessed are those who have not seenand yet have come to believe.”

30.verse: Believe in Order To Live. -Now Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples that are not recorded in this work.

31.verse: But those written here have been recorded so that you may come to believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that through your belief you may have life in his name.

1.verse: Epilogue -Chapter 21 -Jesus Appears to Seven Disciples. -Some time later, Jesus once again revealed himself to his disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, in the following manner.

2.verse: Simon Peter, Thomas called the Twin, Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were gathered together.

3.verse: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going out to fish.” The others replied, “We will go with you.” They set off and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: Shortly after daybreak, Jesus was standing on the shore, but the disciples did not realize that it was Jesus.

5.verse: Jesus called out, “Children, have you caught anything?” When they answered, “No,”

6.verse: he said to them, “Cast the net over the right side of the boat and you will find something.” They did so, and they were unable to haul the net on board because of the great number of fish.

7.verse: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord.” When Simon Peter heard him say that it was the Lord, he wrapped his outer garment around him, for he had taken it off, and jumped into the sea.

8.verse: The other disciples came in the boat, towing the net full of fish, for they were not far from land, only about one hundred yards.

9.verse: When they came ashore, they saw a charcoal fire there, with fish on it, and bread.

10.verse: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish you have just caught.”

11.verse: Simon Peter went on board and dragged the net ashore, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty-three of them. Even though there were so many, the net was not torn.

12.verse: Jesus then said to them, “Come and have breakfast.” None of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew that it was the Lord.

13.verse: Jesus then came forward, took the bread, and gave it to them, and likewise the fish.

14.verse: This was now the third time that Jesus revealed himself to his disciples after his resurrection from the dead.

15.verse: Jesus and Peter. -When they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my lambs.”

16.verse: Jesus said to him again, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Tend my sheep.”

17.verse: Jesus said to him a third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt that Jesus had asked him a third time, “Do you love me?” “Lord,” he said to him, “you know everything. You know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep.

18.verse: “Amen, amen, I say to you,when you were youngyou used to fasten your own beltand you would go wherever you wished.But when you grow old,you will stretch out your hands,and someone else will put a belt around youand take you where you do not wish to go.”

19.verse: He said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. After this, he said to him, “Follow me.”

20.verse: The Beloved Disciple. -Peter looked around and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them—the one who had reclined next to Jesus at the supper and had asked, “Lord, who is it that will betray you?”

21.verse: When Peter saw him, he said to Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”

22.verse: Jesus replied, “If it should be my will that he remain until I come, how does that concern you? Follow me!”

23.verse: The saying then spread among the brethren that this disciple would not die. However, Jesus had not said to Peter, “He will not die,” but, “If it should be my will that he remain until I come, how does that concern you?”

24.verse: Signature of the Redactors. -This is the disciple who testifies to these things and has written them, and we know that his testimony is true.

25.verse: But there are also many other things that Jesus did; and if every one of them was recorded, I do not think the world itself could contain the books that would be written.
